Package io.github.JeremyBloom.mosdex2.span

Class MsdxJavaSpan.Keyed

java.lang.Object
io.github.JeremyBloom.mosdex2.span.MsdxJavaSpan
io.github.JeremyBloom.mosdex2.span.MsdxJavaSpan.Persistent
io.github.JeremyBloom.mosdex2.span.MsdxJavaSpan.Keyed
All Implemented Interfaces:
MsdxSpan, java.io.Serializable
Enclosing class:
MsdxJavaSpan
public static class MsdxJavaSpan.Keyed
extends MsdxJavaSpan.Persistent
This class realizes a Span as a Java map so that it can be accessed by key. The key field name identifies the field in each Record to be used as the key in the map; designating a key field name does not alter the Records, so the key field name can be reassigned in creating a new Keyed Span. Methods inherited from Span generally produce Record streams, so you can perform a series of transformations on the stream without realizing it as a map. You may need to persist the transformed stream again if you want to reuse it.

This class also includes a number of supplemental methods that cannot be executed on a stream.

Author:
Dr. Jeremy A. Bloom (jeremyblmca@gmail.com) Â©2019 Jeremy A. Bloom

  • Constructor Details

    • Keyed

      public Keyed​(java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,​MsdxContainer<java.lang.Object>> records, java.lang.String keyFieldName, MsdxContainer<java.lang.Class<?>> recordSchema)
      Constructs a new Span instance from a map of Records. Wraps the map as a Span; does not copy the stream nor the record Schema, and thus, the new Span is not independent of the original stream. Verifies that the content of each Record conforms to the specified Schema, and throws an exception if it does not.
      Parameters:
      records -
      keyFieldName -
      recordSchema -
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if any of the following violations occurs: the record is missing a field of the schema; or the record has an extra item not in the schema; or the type of an item is not consistent with or not assignment compatible with the type specified in the schema; or the key field name is empty, null, or not found in the schema.

    • Keyed

      public Keyed()
      Creates a Span with an empty stream and Schema.

    • Keyed

      public Keyed​(java.util.stream.Stream<MsdxContainer<java.lang.Object>> records, java.lang.String keyFieldName, MsdxContainer<java.lang.Class<?>> recordSchema)
      Creates a new keyed Span from a stream of Records. Creates a new map from the stream and copies the record Schema; thus, the new Span is independent of the original stream. Verifies that the content of each Record conforms to the specified Schema, and throws an exception if it does not.
      Parameters:
      records -
      keyFieldName -
      recordSchema -
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if any of the following violations occurs: the record is missing a field of the schema; or the record has an extra item not in the schema; or the type of an item is not consistent with or not assignment compatible with the type specified in the schema; or the key field name is empty, null, or not found in the schema.

    • Keyed

      public Keyed​(MsdxSpan span, java.lang.String keyFieldName)
      Creates a new keyed Span from an existing Span and copies the Record schema; thus, the new Span is independent of the existing Span. It also verifies that the content of each Record conforms to the specified Schema, and throws an exception if it does not.
      Parameters:
      span -
      keyFieldName -
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if any of the following violations occurs: the record is missing a field of the schema; or the record has an extra item not in the schema; or the type of an item is not consistent with or not assignment compatible with the type specified in the schema; or the key field name is empty, null, or not found in the schema.

  • Method Details

    • apply

      public java.util.stream.Stream<MsdxContainer<java.lang.Object>> apply()
      Description copied from interface: MsdxSpan
      Returns the items in the Span as a stream of Records. This method is overridden in a persistent Span and a keyed Span. Use of the apply method enables using the inherited transformation methods of this class on either a Record stream or a persistent or keyed Span.

      Note: the inherited methods return a Record stream, so you can perform a series of transformations on the stream without realizing it as a collection. You may need to persist the transformed stream again if you want to reuse it.

      Specified by:
      apply in interface MsdxSpan
      Overrides:
      apply in class MsdxJavaSpan.Persistent

    • union

      public MsdxSpan union​(MsdxSpan other)
      Description copied from interface: MsdxSpan
      Creates a new Span that contains all of the Records in this Span and the other Span. Both Spans must have the same Schema, unless one of them is empty, in which case the union inherits the non-empty schema. (Thus, a sequence of unions can be initialized with an empty Span. If this schema is persistent or keyed, so is the union.)
      Specified by:
      union in interface MsdxSpan
      Overrides:
      union in class MsdxJavaSpan.Persistent
      Parameters:
      other - Span
      Returns:
      a new Span
